headline: Roasted Pumpkin Seeds
description: This easy recipe for roasted pumpkin seeds makes the perfect fall snack. You only need 3 ingredients - pumpkin seeds, butter, and salt.
name: Roasted Pumpkin Seeds

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and gather ingredients.
Toss seeds in a bowl with the melted butter and salt. Spread the seeds in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for about 45 minutes or until golden brown; stir occasionally.

review.reviewBody: Boil and then simmer seeds in salt water until grey, then toss in olive oil and bake. Watch closely so they don't burn
I loved it, never have I boiled the seeds and it made all the difference. I used a seasoning of smoked paprika, little salt and pepper, and garlic powder

This is, by far, the best way to roast pumpkin seeds. My pumpkin was big, so doubled ingredients listed. Simmer in lightly salted water with a TBS of butter until all water has evaporated. This concentrates the salt. Stir in a couple TBS more butter and spread out on 2 pans. It does take longer than times listed, but the results are crisp, and delicious. I went with simple seasoning. Yum! Thanks!!

Love the idea of simmering in salt water first! Couldn't figure out where I went wrong last year and that step was definitely it! Seasoned with butter, seasoning salt (hy's), spicy Montreal steak spice (la grille), smouldering smoked Applewood (la grille), and curry powder... Added all the seasonings into the melted butter first then tossed them into the pumpkin seeds and cooked on the top rack. Absolutely addictive, taste like candy!!
This recipe is easy and delicious. I used butter and added curry powder! Tomorrow I’m out looking for pumpkins on clearance!
The seeds definitely need to sit out to dry before baking
I loved it super crispy and delicious 10/10 would recommend to anyone up to a fall favorite!
Sweet receipe was amazing!
Sea salt is the best!

Made them according to the recipe except I added a little olive oil with the butter and a little sea salt. Then I put them on my smoker at 275 for 45 minutes. Did not add any wood for smoke, just used the lump charcoal. Turned out great!
nice!
After rinsing and drying the seeds a bit with a towel, I stirred in avocado oil, salt, and pepper. Then roasted to recipe's directions. Delicious!
My Brother loved it. This is my second time making them. Last year I made 2 batches this year 4. He is giving some as gifts.
Delicious and easy to do.
Made as described but used canola oil instead of butter to make it dairy free. Will definitely try some of the suggestions in the reviews next time to give it a little something extra.

I think "pinch of salt" is misleading -- a quarter teaspoon for three cups of seeds should suffice, if you're using salted butter. I found these way too salty. I was surprised to read one reviewer doubled the recipe and used two TABLESPOONS of salt. I prefer olive oil and a judicious amount of salt over using this recipe.

instead of tossing them with salt and butter, I tossed the seeds in cinnamon brown sugar and olive oil. I also used creole seasoning in one batch, and garlic, hot paprika, and red pepper in the recipe...so very good and a great recipe to make after pumping carving.!!!loved it so much!! great recipe
I used extra virgin olive oil instead of butter
Delicious! Made this with my daughter. Makes you want to go collect the seeds from every pumpkin carved in October so you can snack on the roasted goodness all year.
It's sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo YUMMY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Tats like popcorn I wish people would sell them for mony.

To compliment a few other posts, it's a real good idea to boil the seeds first in a salt water solution to incorporate salt into the seeds. Also, I've found that rinsing the seeds/guts in cold water prevents them from getting too soggy prior to putting them into saltwater. Lastly, allowing them to partially air dry on a towel before baking can shorten cook time (@ 250°) and can make them a little crispier when done.
It was delicious
Tasty!
I make any kind of squash seeds. It's simple and I use popcorn salt to add to the flavor.
I loved this recipe. I don't use real butter but added a little vegan butter. The second bb batch I made spicier and that was good too. Thank you.
It was a nice snack they are great
Useful but I added garlic and onion powder and it tastes amazing. Good job
Took much less time than suggested
I used pink salt. Came out delicious

Great as is. Nice and crispy. I did modify a batch to our taste with some garlic. Tried the sugar version recommended by others and it was good too, but I preferred the original version. Thanks! PS I did dry the cleaned seeds for a couple days and that may have helped with the crispy texture but I'm not sure.

Pulled out all the seeds, put it in a pot with water and they float to the top! Then lay out in a single layer and let dry 24 hrs. Then mix with 1 tblsp Oliver oil, butter and salt. Also added a pinch of garlic powder. Put on foil in a single layer and baked at 300 for 35 min until Golden Brown. Perfect!
Garlic salt and powder.

Pro tip: to dry the seeds completely, put them in a colander, and hold a hair dryer straight above the colander. Don’t aim the hair dryer at an angle or else the seeds will fly everywhere. Shuffle seeds with your hands as you dry. Takes 5 minutes to completely dry the seeds.
Great recipe, fantastic seeds. I used 5 cups of seeds, and adjusted the measurements to match. I also added some garlic nuggets. Outstanding!

Excellent! The low and slow method this recipe uses makes the whole seed crunchy and tasty. In the past I've used a higher temp for shorter time, and the outside is always too fibrous. The use of butter is decadently indulgent - greasy yummy fun!
Quick, easy, and fun! They make the house smell wonderful while in the oven
I left seeds out soaking in red Hawaiian sea salt for 24hrs than followed recipe. I finally got pumpkin seeds to taste awesome!

Only reason why I have it four stars was because it only needs to be in for 30 min, and more then a pinch or f salt is needed m. Last year I did 45 min and they got burnt tasting. Otherwise this year, turned out great.
Just added extra. Virgin olive oil
Used cinnamon sugar with a little salt..YUM!!

Excellent recipe. I read other reviews and many suggested boiling in salt water to get a better seasoning flavour. I’m way too lazy and impatient to do that but I have another tip that worked out very well. I took my kosher salt and blitzed it in my nutribullet to make it a fine powder and the result was excellent. Definitely blend up more than you need as it’s tough to collect the powder then toss it in a bowl with the butter or oil to ensure it’s equally distributed and the result was excellent and well seasoned. An old restaurant trick someone taught me.
Good
I loved it!!! Definitely would recommend. I'm so excited to keep using this app!!!
Easy recipe. Nope, just followed the directions. Tastes great!

When i was little my Grandma made some roasted pumpkin seeds and they were delicious! So i was thinking about what i could make for thanksgiving and i was like um..a turkey but what else well pumpkin seeds! thank you so much for giving me this recipe so i sti have a memory of time with my grandma (shes still alive but i'm not able to see her .
This recipie was super simple and reminiscent of Halloweens with pumpkin seeds I had as a kid.
I added some pepper and garlic powder. They are delicious
I LOVED them. They need 1 more pinch of salt and another 1/2 TBSP of butter, but other than they they were AMAZING.
Used extra virgin olive oil instead of butter can't stop eating them. Pinch cayenne pepper, salt garlic powder, onion powder variation
Made it on Halloween Night. Was just what I hoped for! Fun to do as well

Boiling is a must! I boiled the seeds in salt water . And then roasted them with cinnamon and a little oil (just to grease the pan). My kids said they tasted like popcorn. I've roasted pumpkin seeds before without boiling them-they were not bad but no one went back for seconds, boiling was the missing step that made these fantastic!!

Delicious! I like mine so crunchy that it's easy to eat the whole seed and this did it. I had one cup of seeds and could have reduced the butter a little because I didn't have as much seeds at the recipe called for but they turned out perfect. I stirred every 15 minutes. Thanks Rosemary.
I would add a little more salt but it's good
Put a little extra butter. Wanted more flavor like popcorn. Turned out great! Would make it again!
Make sure you dry seed for 24-48 hours before making.
Simple and tasty!

Loved it. I used A pinch of salt and Trader Joe's Onion Salt blend and I stirred every 10 minutes. . Yum! Also, I use a fork to comb out seeds before diggy out strings. Works for me. And lastly, I love taking basic recipes and experimenting after the first time or two so please keep the suggestions and comments coming on all recipes!
Easy and delicious!
Very good but a little too much butter
Very good, some butter and fine salt, :25 minutes or so, I agree when they are golden brown they’re ready
One of my Favorite things to make around Halloween!!! Roasted Pumpkin Seeds
I followed the recipe however I add Worcester sauce and garlic powder to the butter before tossing. They come out so delicious I actually have to hide some so my husband doesn't eat them all.
This is one of the best recipes yet! It's a keeper!

Since I do not use garlic powder (I prefer fresh garlic), I used a seasoning condiment (like a Mrs Dash but with sea salt), and it tasted heavenly. I am now hooked on doing my own roasted pumpkin seeds with a little spicey herbs for flavour.
Super easy and delicious! My family loved them and already asked me when I'm going to make more. Thank you for this recipe!
I followed the suggestions of boiling the seeds then drying them overnight before oven roasting- perfection!

I used fresh out of the pumpkin, pumpkin seed. I washed them and laid out to dry for 24 hours. I doubled the recipe because I had so many seeds but I think the baking time was a bit too long. Mine came out a bit burnt. I should have checked more often but my expectations were higher.
Doesn’t matter is salt gets on the inside. They’re pumpkin seeds, not at all like sunflower seeds, you eat the shell too.
Addedd a bit more salt
Simple and easy recipe. We might have left it too long in the oven, but I think it still tasted OK. Perfect for right after pumpkin carving.
I made these but also included some garlic and onion powder and a little cajun seasoning for color. They came out SO SO SO good!
These turned out pretty good. I did mine with a teaspoon of salt and a pinch of pepper. But i like things salty.

Pretty much all of the 5-star reviews that I read after making this myself (and trying to figure out what I did wrong) have tweaked the recipe. In my opinion, a pinch of salt that the recipe calls for is no where near enough and I don't usually even care much for salty foods.
was great. everyone loved it
I made this I hope it good.

I substituted coconut oil for the butter but used a small amount of blue bonnet to add some butter flavor I used it all mixed to taste in way more than what was suggested and tossed it in a colander by dipping it into the bowl of coconut oil and blue bonnet and then tossing it to distribute it evenly then suspended it above using bbq tongs let drain for about 5 minutes while preheat oven... then I tossed it again with kosher salt and spread it on the pan and roasted it as with the recipe... the family loved it... and I reserved the coconut oil and blue bonnet mixture for my next few batches... because I've saved all the seeds I need for next season and I have a lot of pie pumpkins to cook this month...
I made the recipe exactly as originally written (except I used vegan butter) and it was delicious.
Will totally make again! But I boiled my seeds in salt water and dried them in paper towels before I seasoned and baked

I did everything but I also saw a "spicy" version and made my own. I did all the steps in this recipe but 10 mins after they had roasted I added Mrs Dash No Salt, Garlic Herb. They are addictive even with the shell. I also didn't have to roast them quite as long for my taste.
Go easy on the salt, but great recipe!

This is the simplest recipe for someone just starting out. I've been roasting seeds for years and my favorite is this: gut the pumpkin and separate the seeds. Rinse and then soak the seeds in salt water over night up to 24 hours, then I lay them out on parchment paper and paper towels to dry, typically overnight to 24 hours. I then take them off the paper towels and spread them out on the parchment paper to continue drying. Once I'm happy with how dry the seeds are I then follow the above recipe. I suggest roasting the seeds in multiple batches to prevent them from being under cooked or potentially burning. I do this in multiple batches depending how many pumpkins I have. My way is not hard, it just takes several days to do a batch, but they come out perfect every time.
Have been making pumpkin seeds like this for decades. There are those who want to complicate basic things. Just make them as written they are delicious.
Perfect recipe as written Great for first-timers or if you have been baking them a long time. Simple.
Thèse came out so good. I used chipotle seasoned olive oil and 3/4 a cup of seeds.
Perfectly simple. my family devoured them!
Super easy recipe that turned out delicious and the house smells amazing! Great simple way to use all those seeds when carving pumpkins.
i put more salt and less butter

This recipe worked really well! Thank you. As my grandma can't have butter I used coconut oil instead. I didn't make a difference! My family was fighting over them they were so good. I did add a sprinkle of pepper before they went into the oven. My Mom said they were especially delicious when sprinkled with cayenne.
These are so delicious they didn’t last long at all.
taste like popcorn!
All these years and I'd never roasted seeds with butter! Really love the flavor these get. Also works great with squash seeds!
i added cinnamon sugar
I added 1 tbsp. Melted butter and used two tsp of Nature's Seasons instead of Salt. Turned out great. Family loved it.
Very good basic recipe. You can't go wrong with this simple one.

We boiled our seeds in salty water. Waiting until they turned grey. Placed on a cookie sheet and roasted at 250 until dry. First time to make these and I preferred it this way. My mom did the original recipe and it wasn’t as salty.
They came out good as is. I'd like to try and experiment with different spices next time. Always a good salty treat.

This is as good as my mother used to make when I was a child (I never got her recipe). I added a light sprinkling of coarse pickling salt for appearance’s sake. I found a few extra minutes roasting time if the seeds are deeper in the pan. What a great Hallowe’en treat!
Easy to make and granddaughter loves them. Have become a yearly tradition.
Add lemon juice and black pepper for extra flavour and to substitute for dad
